video.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare (Zero Punctuation)

captions.text: My latest book in the Jack McKean saga: &quot;Will Destroy the Galaxy for Cash&quot; is available now from audible.com, as an audiobook
Obviously. That&#39;s kind of their whole thing.
It was nice to see Call of Duty making the important first step of realizing it had a problem
I mean I could and did indeed pointed this out, around the time they were hiring Kit Harington to play a space terrorist from Mars
No offense, Kit Harington
I&#39;m sure you&#39;re a perfectly decent fellow, It&#39;s just that your presence often seems to be an open&#39; of ill fortune
You&#39;re like a banshee, but with mouth-breathing instead of shrieking.
So Call of Duty put on its thinking cap and went
&quot;There&#39;s got to be somewhere we can get back to the times where people liked us and gave us lots of money&quot;
And that&#39;s when they realized the solution
Was staring them in the face. &quot;Of course! Redo Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare!&quot;
But different and then title it to call of duty modern warfare.
- Well, that is different
You took an entire numeral out of the original title better slow down your revolutionary Zell before you start decapitating French monarchs Activision
No, but really we&#39;re updating Modern Warfare to more reflect the shape of international conflicts today rather than what it was in 2007.
Oh, ok. So the plot will mainly be about
Burly professional American soldiers getting pulled out of the Middle East because a dictator rang up the president
And the president didn&#39;t want to look lame in front of the cool kids
No, of course it bloody won&#39;t it&#39;ll be Middle Eastern terrorists and evil Russians again
Except for the new mealy-mouthed Ubisoft desk aversion to taking political stances. The characters will occasionally look to camera and go boy
it&#39;s a shame how all these unflinchingly Saturday morning cartoon villainous Russians are reflecting badly on all those nice norm Skeletor like Russians none of
Whom we are showing you would do assuredly exist. Don&#39;t be fooled
This whole exercise is just an attempt at a second dip in the trough
Marginally more sophisticated than the last attempt the rerelease of Call of Duty 4 but trussed up with micropayments
dangled from the ceiling like a party GIMP.
All talk of updating the franchise and bringing it to new heights was bold-faced porky pies because
Activision know that the true audience for this game doesn&#39;t actually want innovation
They want the scene that happens at the end of the campaign
Where Captain Price the amazing human Weetabix literally reads off a list of named characters from previous
modern warfare games then winks to camera as it to say you may now soil yourselves in excitement.
As for the gameplay, pick up the gun and shooty-shooty constant chaos spunkgargleweewee (I can&#39;t believe I typed this)
Oh, why weren&#39;t those meddling politicians let us murder foreigners as we see fit
wanky wanky spy on your neighbors patriot act
racism
Have they gone yet?
Have the Call of Duty fans heard enough and fucked off to buy it in droves yet?
Right, serious question for the rest of you.
Why are you here? Why are any of us here?
Did you really expect to hear something interesting about the new fucking Call of Duty?
It&#39;s like going to a baseball game and saying &quot;yeah, all the hitting balls and running around a diamond is kind of boring
But maybe they&#39;ll do something different with it this time.&quot;
I&#39;m sick of talking about it
But now that you are here expecting your Modern Warfare review. Let&#39;s talk about Disco Elysium instead
That&#39;s right! STEALTH INDIE REVIEW!
You just got lured into a shadow by a thrown object in contextual button neck snapped motherfucker!
You, the people watching sweary reviews of our Call of Duty, are exactly the kind of people who need to hear about games like this
So listen up,
In contrast to what you might think Disco Elysium is from the title
- And what would that be yahtz?
Well, anyway
It&#39;s an isometric RPG in the Planescape torment sort of mould about a disheveled detective in the melter - dystopian world has been sent to
Investigate a murder, but the murder investigation isn&#39;t the plot
So not just the quiet
Fastidious housemate of the plot that stays in its room most of the time and sits in the corner reading its phone during parties solving
The murder is just a thing on your to-do list given no more emphasis than your intention to find a cigarette or scratch your ass
It&#39;s actually a story about a man who burned out drank himself into oblivion and must now rebuild his entire identity from scratch
You don&#39;t even know about the investigation at first
You didn&#39;t find out your fucking name for the first couple of days
you start off in a trashed hotel room with no memory having to pass skill checks to look at yourself in the mirror and get
Your tie down from a ceiling fan. So in brief, it&#39;s Planescape torment meets Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
And when I say skilled checks, I don&#39;t mean rolling for strength or lock-picking
Where the fuck do you think you are and Gimli son of Gloin instead you put points into rhetoric
conceptualization savoir faire and various other aspects of personality all of which have their own distinct voice in your head ensuring that the main character
Has as much dialogue with himself as he does with other characters and two times shitloads is a lot of shit loads, buddy
Yes
I should stress that if you&#39;re scared off by too much reading then you&#39;d better move along and get back to shooting scary foreigners because
Disk of Elysium is worthier than an N R and monologuing that dumpster full of refrigerator poetry kids
Which is normally something that turns me off and my eyes were blazing over as I skimmed through the 14th political debate with the passing
Milkman, but this might have been my fault for trying to see every dialog for completeness
His sake disco allows him is a game that requires a shift in attitude
my usual instinct is to focus squarely on the main goal because I&#39;ve got deadlines to meet and pure a euphemism to concoct but this
is a game for meandering and letting the pieces fall as they may
No following icons on mini maps here
and now it&#39;s all check out the building behind the crime scene and it&#39;s like five buildings that that could mean so all you can
Do is bumble around sure you could ask the suspects direct questions about the murder and listen to them recite their carefully rehearsed statements
But it&#39;s more fun to ask them how they know that physical reality exists or what it is that makes the stars turn on at
Night and watch them get completely thrown for a loop
So I eventually got into the spirit of things spending my evenings drinking
Methylated spirits and arguing with road signs in the game. I made and found myself getting quite absorbed
It&#39;s a densely fiercely intelligent a written game, but the humor and weird engines make it fascinatingly accessible
I won&#39;t call it my game of the year
there&#39;s a lot that niggles make
The isometric world is very
Confusingly laid out and only becomes more of a slog to navigate as it expands the way different clothing items affect
Your stats drags me back down to video game land when I find I can pause the conversation when I see a skill check coming
Up put on a Hawaiian shirt wellington boots into cool e hat and maximize my stat bonus
But these nickels are pointless because discs of Elysium is a bonafide a work of art elevates the medium of video games
No, it&#39;s not for everyone but making games as broad as possible as long been the major part of the fucking problem
The reason my following mainstream releases is like watching a sausage making machine filling condoms with glue
Speaking of which, better get back on topic, in case any Call of Duty fans decided to skip to the end.
Ooh pick up that grenade, ratatat ratatat, strawberry jam on the glasses. Bay of Pigs, Iran, Contra, 70% on Metacritic, etc, etc
Stick it up your fucking BUM Activision
